raw_text:
D'Arcy injury adds to Ireland woe
 
 Gordon D'Arcy has been ruled out of the Ireland team for Saturday's Six Nations clash against Scotland in Murrayfield.
 
 Like skipper Brian O'Driscoll, D'Arcy failed to recover from a hamstring injury. The side will now be led by Munster lock Paul O'Connell. Shane Horgan switches from wing to centre where he will be joined by Ulster's Kevin Maggs. Girvan Dempsey comes into the team to take the right wing spot while Gavin Duffy is called up to the replacements. ''We gave Gordon a chance but it didn't work out,'' said Ireland coach Eddie O'Sullivan. ''In terms of the risk element, it was a sensible precaution. He should be fine for the next game but we do not want to tempt fate.''
 
 Maggs, who will win his 67th cap, was the obvious replacement at centre while Shane Horgan was always likely to be moved from the wing. The only other change to the Ireland side from last weekend's win in Rome sees Wasps flanker Johnny O'Connor replacing Denis Leamy. O'Connor will be winning his third cap after making his debut in the victory over South Africa last November.
 
 : Murphy, Dempsey, Horgan, Maggs, Hickie, O'Gara, Stringer, Corrigan, Byrne, Hayes, O'Kelly, O'Connell, capt, S Easterby, O'Connor, Foley.
 
 : Sheahan, Horan, O'Callaghan, Miller, G Easterby, Humphreys, Duffy.
llama3.2:1b: Gordon D'Arcy ruled out of Ireland's Six Nations clash against Scotland due to a hamstring injury, with Munster lock Paul O'Connell leading the side.

Munster lock Paul O'Connell will lead the team, with Shane Horgan moving from wing to centre and Kevin Maggs replacing him at centre.
Johnny O'Connor replaces Denis Leamy in midfield.

The side will now be led by Paul O'Connell and will include Munster lock Paul O'Connell as the captain.
Shane Horgan is being released from his position on wing and will play centre.
Kevin Maggs replaces Johnny O'Connor for Wasps flanker Denis Leamy, who previously won his third cap.

Gordon was previously sidelined from recovery.

deepseek-r1:1.5b:
D'Arcy injury adds to Ireland woe  
Gordon D'Arcy was ruled out of the team lineup for Saturday's Six Nations clash, as he was found to have a hamstring injury.
The team now leads with Paul O'Connell instead of Brian O'Driscoll.
Shane Horgan moves from wing to center and will be joined by Kevin Maggs at center.
Girvan Dempsey takes the right wing spot, while Gavin Duffy is added for substitutions.

We gave Gordon a chance but it didn't work out:  
Ireland coach Eddie O'Sullivan acknowledged the risk element introduced by D'Arcy's injury.
He remains healthy for the next match but wants to ensure safety and avoid tempting fate.

Substitution details:  
- Maggs, who will win his 67th cap, takes center instead of Shane Horgan.
- Horgan moves from wing to center.
- Shane Horgan was likely on the wing but moved back to center.
- Gavin Duffy is added for substitutions.

Lineup changes:  
- D'Arcy injury adds to Ireland's injury list.
- Maggs and Horgan are substituted out.
- Shane Horgan moves back from wing to center.
- The team receives substitution players: Paul O'Connell, Shane Horgan, Kevin Maggs, Girvan Dempsey, Gavin Duffy, Johnny O'Connor, and others listed below.
tinyllama:1.1b: After Gordon D'Arcy underwent a hamstring injury during Ireland's game against Scotland in Murrayfield, Eddie O'Sullivan has selected Paul O'Conneill as the skipper for the upcoming match against Scotland.
Shane Horan and Kevin Maggs will replace injured Ulster lock Paul O'Connor and Denis Leamy respectively.
The only change from last week's win is that Wasps flanker Johnny O'Connor replaces South African international Jan Hattingh as a substitute in the match.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Ireland will now have to manage without their leading scorer and captain in the upcoming Six Nations clash against Scotland in Murrayfield on Saturday.
In a surprising development, forward Gordon D'Arcy has been ruled out of the team due to a hamstring injury, with his place taken by Munster lock Paul O'Connell.

The change will be significant for Ireland, who had already made significant changes to their lineup with the addition of Shane Horgan from Ulster and the removal of Gavin Duffy from the starting lineup.
This will also have an impact on the match strategy and could result in strategic adjustments to suit the opposing team's matchup.
phi:2.7b: D'Arcy has been ruled out of the Ireland team for Saturday's Six Nations clash against Scotland in Murrayfield due to a hamstring injury.
The side will be led by Munster lock Paul O'Connell, with Shane Horgan switching from wing to centre and joining Ulster'S Kevin Maggs at right-wing.
Gavin Duffy is also called up for replacements.
Ireland coach Eddie O'Sullivan said they gave Gordon a chance but it didn't work out as it was a sensible precaution.
He should be fine for the next game, but they do not want to take any chances.
Maggs will play at centre and Horgan has always been expected to move from wing.
Denis Leamy is replaced by Wasps flanker Johnny O'Connor who won his third cap in last week's win against South Africa.

Shane Horgan switches from wing to center, where he is joined by Kevin Maggs.
Girvan Dempsey comes into the team to take the right wing spot while Gavin Duffy is called up to replace O'Driscoll and Horgan.
Gordon D'Arcy was ruled out of the Scotland game with a hamstring injury, but should be fine for the next game.
The only other change to the Ireland side from last weekend's win in Rome sees Wasps flanker Johnny O'Connor replacing Denis Leamy.
: O'Connor will be winning his third cap after making his debut in the victory over South Africa last November.

Munster's Paul O'Connell will lead the team.

Coach Eddie O'Sullivan stated they took a precautionary approach with D'Arcy, expecting him to be fit for the next game.

The team will be led by Paul O'Connell, with Shane Horgan and Kevin Maggs making switches.
Johnny O'Connor replaces Denis Leamy for this match.

granite3.1-dense:2b: Gordon D'Arcy is sidelined due to a hamstring injury for Ireland's Six Nations match against Scotland at Murrayfield on Saturday.
The team will be captained by Paul O'Connell and feature Shane Horgan as centre, with Kevin Maggs joining him.
Gavan Dempsey takes over from the right wing, and Gavin Duffy is named among the replacements.
Ireland coach Eddie O'Sullivan deemed this precautionary, aiming to prevent further harm.
The only other alteration is Johnny O'Connor replacing Denis Leamy at flanker, marking his third cap after debuting in the win over South Africa.

The final lineup remains largely unchanged from Ireland's victory in Rome last weekend: Murphy, Dempsey, Horgan, Maggs, Hickie, O'Gara, Stringer, Corrigan, Byrne, Hayes, O'Kelly, O'Connell (capt), S Easterby, and Foley.
